Reasoning: **My Analysis of the Planet Pack Selection**

Okay, here's the situation: I'm staring at the Celestial Pack selection screen. It's Round 9, with an ante of 4/8, and I've got $38 in the bank. Let's see, my Joker lineup is looking pretty solid: Green Joker (Holo), Mystic Summit, Spare Trousers, Certificate, Luchador (the boss-buster), and that pesky Constellation.

Now, my hand levels are: Full House Level 4 (good base chips and mult), Pair Level 4 (solid fallback), Three of a Kind Level 4, and some lower levels for other hands. I'm focusing on consistent, high-scoring hands.

I have three planets to choose from: Pluto (High Card, not really my style), Mercury (Pair, leveling up a hand I already play, Level 4 to 5), and Mars (Four of a Kind, a big jump, Level 1 to 2, but harder to hit).

The crucial point: any planet selection will trigger Constellation, which will increase my Multiplier. Constellation is currently at x2.0 but will go up to x2.1 with any planet selected.

My goal is to pick the planet that gives me the most utility, or strengthens a hand I can *actually* play. Mercury, leveling a Pair, is a *reliable* option because Pairs are easy to come by, even as part of other hands (though only the scoring hand counts).

Mars gives a much bigger boost, leveling a Four of a Kind, but is tougher to pull off, even with Certificate adding some extra cards. Pluto is just not good.

Considering past hand history, Three of a Kind, Full House, and Flushes have been my bread and butter. Spare Trousers rewards Two Pair. Two Pair contains a Pair, and is fairly easy to get.

While leveling up a Pair is consistent, and is level 4, Mercury would get me to Level 5. Strengthening a hand I actually *play* is the priority. Actually, strengthening Pair is a good option since it's easy to pivot to.

Mercury is the best choice here. Leveling up Pair offers the most consistent value, while allowing me to pivot to Two Pair. Leveling Four of a Kind is a better scaling value, but is harder to trigger.

**Action: Select Mercury**

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

**Analyzing the Shop and Planning the Next Moves**

Okay, so I'm in the shop phase, post-Celestial Pack, with $38 in the bank. My immediate goal is to maximize my score to clear Ante 8. I have a decent base setup: Green Joker (Holo, +10 Mult), Mystic Summit (+15 Mult), Spare Trousers (+2 Mult, scaling on Two Pair), Certificate (adds a random card), Luchador (Polychrome, x1.5 Mult, sell to disable Boss), and most importantly, Constellation (Negative, x2.1 Mult, scaling with Planet cards). I'm also holding Grabber (+1 hand) and Hieroglyph (-1 Ante, -1 hand). My hand levels are decent: Pair (Lv 5), Full House (Lv 4), and Three of a Kind (Lv 4).

Given my resources, I have three solid options in the shop: Mail-In Rebate ($4 - not useful right now), Wheel of Fortune ($3), and an Arcana Pack ($4). My scaling relies on Constellation (Planet cards), Spare Trousers (Two Pair), and the Green Joker (hands played). My economy is healthy enough to support some calculated risks, but I want to keep fueling Constellation.

The initial instinct is to buy an Arcana Pack to potentially get Planet cards, but the Wheel of Fortune is also tempting with a 1 in 4 chance of getting a Joker edition. Given the cheap cost, the Wheel of Fortune is appealing.

Considering the previous thought process, I had planned to grab Grabber, a Celestial Pack, then *potentially* an Arcana Pack followed by a Wheel of Fortune. The Grabber and Celestial Pack are done, so the next step is the Arcana Pack.

Therefore, the action is `buy_booster 1` (Arcana Pack).

Before I make the purchase, I need to confirm the Joker positions. Right now they are positioned correctly with additive Jokers on the left and multiplicative Jokers on the right, which is the correct way to set this up for optimization.

So, the play is to buy the Arcana Pack first.
